org.hkijena.jipipe.extensions.imagejdatatypes.datatypes

Class ROIListData

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Roi>
          • org.hkijena.jipipe.extensions.imagejdatatypes.datatypes.ROIListData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Roi>, Collection<Roi>, List<Roi>, RandomAccess, JIPipeData

    public class ROIListData
extends ArrayList<Roi>
implements JIPipeData
    Contains Roi

        ignoreT - ignore T constraint

      • exportData

        public void exportData(JIPipeWriteDataStorage storage,
                       String name,
                       boolean forceName,
                       JIPipeProgressInfo progressInfo)
        Description copied from interface: JIPipeData
        Saves the data to a folder
        Specified by:
        exportData in interface JIPipeData
        Parameters:
        storage - The storage where the data should be written
        name - A name reference that can be used to generate filename(s)
        forceName - If enabled, the data is saved potentially destructively. Generated files must always contain the name parameter. This is used to collect results for humans or other algorithms.
        progressInfo - the progress

      • display

        public void display(String displayName,
                    JIPipeWorkbench workbench,
                    JIPipeDataSource source)
        Description copied from interface: JIPipeData
        This function should display the data in the GUI. The UI can handle multiple of such operations via JIPipeDataDisplayOperation that can be registered separately. This item will always be shown as "Default" in the list of operations.
        Specified by:
        display in interface JIPipeData
        Parameters:
        displayName - a name that can be used
        workbench - the workbench
        source - optional source of the data. Can be null or any kind of data type (e.g. JIPipeDataSlot)

                           boolean drawOutline,
                           boolean drawFilledOutline,
                           int lineThickness)
        Generates a mask image from pure ROI data. The ROI's reference images are ignored.
        Parameters:
        imageArea - modifications for the image area
        drawOutline - whether to draw an outline
        drawFilledOutline - whether to fill the area
        lineThickness - line thickness for drawing
        Returns:
        the image

      • toRGBImage

                               ROIElementDrawingMode drawOutline,

                               int defaultLineThickness,
                               Color defaultFillColor,
                               Color defaultLineColor)
        Generates an RGB image from pure ROI data. The ROI's reference images are ignored.
        Parameters:
        imageArea - modifications for the image area
        drawOutline - whether to draw an outline
        drawFilledOutline - whether to fill the area
        defaultLineThickness - line thickness for drawing
        defaultFillColor - the default fill color
        defaultLineColor - the default line color
        Returns:
        the image

      • toMask

        public ij.ImagePlus toMask(ij.ImagePlus reference,
                           boolean drawFilledOutline,
                           boolean drawOutline,
                           int lineThickness)
        Converts this ROI list into a mask that has the same size as the reference image
        Parameters:
        reference - the reference image
        drawFilledOutline - fill the ROI
        drawOutline - draw the ROI outlines
        lineThickness - the ROI line thickness
        Returns:
        the mask

      • toMask

        public ij.ImagePlus toMask(boolean drawFilledOutline,
                           boolean drawOutline,
                           int lineThickness,
                           int width,
                           int height,
                           int numSlices,
                           int numChannels,
                           int numFrames)
        Converts this ROI list into a mask that has the same size as the reference image
        Parameters:
        drawFilledOutline - fill the ROI
        drawOutline - draw the ROI outlines
        lineThickness - the ROI line thickness
        width - output image width
        height - output image height
        numSlices - output image Z slices
        numChannels - output image channel slices
        numFrames - output image frame slices
        Returns:
        the mask

      • getMaskForSlice

        public ij.ImagePlus getMaskForSlice(int width,
                                    int height,
                                    boolean drawOutline,
                                    boolean drawFilledOutline,
                                    int lineThickness,
                                    ImageSliceIndex sliceIndex)
        Generates a mask image from pure ROI data. The ROI's reference images are ignored.
        Parameters:
        width - the image width
        height - the image height
        drawOutline - whether to draw an outline
        drawFilledOutline - whether to fill the area
        lineThickness - line thickness for drawing
        sliceIndex - zero-based slice index
        Returns:
        the image

      • draw

        public void draw(ij.ImagePlus rgbImage,
                 boolean ignoreZ,
                 boolean ignoreC,
                 boolean ignoreT,
                 ROIElementDrawingMode drawOutline,
                 ROIElementDrawingMode fillOutline,
                 int defaultLineThickness,
                 Color defaultFillColor,
                 Color defaultLineColor)
        Draw on top of an RGB image
        Parameters:
        rgbImage - the target image
        drawOutline - draw an outline
        fillOutline - fill the outline
        ignoreZ - do not constrain Z
        ignoreC - do not constrain channel
        ignoreT - do not constrain frame
        defaultLineThickness - default line thickness
        defaultFillColor - default fill color
        defaultLineColor - default line color

      • draw

        public void draw(ij.process.ImageProcessor processor,
                 ImageSliceIndex currentIndex,
                 boolean ignoreZ,
                 boolean ignoreC,
                 boolean ignoreT,
                 boolean drawOutline,
                 boolean fillOutline,
                 boolean drawLabel,
                 int defaultLineThickness,
                 Color defaultFillColor,
                 Color defaultLineColor,
                 Collection<Roi> highlighted)
        Draw on top of an RGB processor with specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        processor - the target processor
        currentIndex - current index in the stack
        ignoreZ - do not constrain Z
        ignoreC - do not constrain channel
        ignoreT - do not constrain frame
        drawOutline - draw an outline
        fillOutline - fill the outline
        drawLabel - draw labels
        defaultLineThickness - default line thickness
        defaultFillColor - default fill color
        defaultLineColor - default line color
        highlighted - highlighted rois (other ones are drawn darker)

      • drawMaskForSliceIndex

        public void drawMaskForSliceIndex(boolean drawOutline,
                                  boolean drawFilledOutline,
                                  int lineThickness,
                                  ij.ImagePlus result,
                                  ImageSliceIndex sliceIndex)
        Draws the ROI over an existing mask image
        Parameters:
        drawOutline - whether to draw an outline
        drawFilledOutline - whether to fill the area
        lineThickness - line thickness for drawing
        result - the target image
        sliceIndex - zero-based slice index

      • drawMask

        public void drawMask(boolean drawOutline,
                     boolean drawFilledOutline,
                     int lineThickness,
                     ij.ImagePlus result)
        Draws the ROI over an existing mask image
        Parameters:
        drawOutline - whether to draw an outline
        drawFilledOutline - whether to fill the area
        lineThickness - line thickness for drawing
        result - the target image

      • addToRoiManager

        public void addToRoiManager(ij.plugin.frame.RoiManager roiManager)
        Adds the ROI to an existing ROI manager instance
        Parameters:
        roiManager - the ROI manager

      • mergeWith

        public void mergeWith(ROIListData other)
        Merges the ROI from another data into this one. Creates copies of the merged Roi
        Parameters:
        other - the other data. The entries are copied.

      • outline

        public void outline(RoiOutline outline)
        Outlines all Roi in this list by the specified algorithm. All Roi are replaced by their outline.
        Parameters:
        outline - the method

      • splitAll

        public void splitAll()
        Splits all ShapeRoi that consist of multiple sub-Roi into their individual sub-Roi. The original ShapeRoi is removed.

      • getBounds

        public Rectangle getBounds()
        Returns the bounds of area described by the Roi
        Returns:
        the bounds. if no Roi are present, a Rectangle with zero size is returned

      • logicalOr

        public void logicalOr()
        Applies a logical OR operation to all Roi in this list. This means that all Roi are combined into a single Roi

      • logicalAnd

        public void logicalAnd()
        Applies a logical AND operation to all Roi in this list. This means that the output is one Roi containing the intersection.

      • logicalXor

        public void logicalXor()
        Applies a logical XOR operation on the list of Roi.

      • containsOnlyRoisOfType

        public boolean containsOnlyRoisOfType(int type)
        Returns if this ROI list only contains ROI of given type
        Parameters:
        type - the ROI type. Can be RECTANGLE=0, OVAL=1, POLYGON=2, FREEROI=3, TRACED_ROI=4, LINE=5, POLYLINE=6, FREELINE=7, ANGLE=8, COMPOSITE=9, or POINT=10
        Returns:
        if this ROI list only contains ROI of given type

      • countRoisOfType

        public int countRoisOfType(int type)
        Counts all ROIs of given type
        Parameters:
        type - the ROI type. Can be RECTANGLE=0, OVAL=1, POLYGON=2, FREEROI=3, TRACED_ROI=4, LINE=5, POLYLINE=6, FREELINE=7, ANGLE=8, COMPOSITE=9, or POINT=10
        Returns:
        number of ROI with type Roi.POINT

      • measure

        public ResultsTableData measure(ij.ImagePlus imp,
                                ImageStatisticsSetParameter measurements,
                                boolean addNameToTable)
        Generates ROI statistics
        Parameters:
        imp - the reference image. Can be null to measure on a black image. Warning: If you provide an existing image that should not be changed, make a duplicate!
        measurements - which measurements to extract
        addNameToTable - if true, add the ROI's name to the table
        Returns:
        the measurements

      • getChannelPosition

        public int getChannelPosition()
        The overall channel position of the ROIs. If the position is not exactly defined, this function returns 0 Returns 0 if no ROIs are in the list
        Returns:
        the overall channel position. 1-based index. 0 equals that the ROIs are at multiple locations

      • getStackPosition

        public int getStackPosition()
        The overall stack position of the ROIs. If the position is not exactly defined, this function returns 0 Returns 0 if no ROIs are in the list
        Returns:
        the overall stack position. 1-based index. 0 equals that the ROIs are at multiple locations

      • getFramePosition

        public int getFramePosition()
        The overall frame position of the ROIs. If the position is not exactly defined, this function returns 0 Returns 0 if no ROIs are in the list
        Returns:
        the overall frame position. 1-based index. 0 equals that the ROIs are at multiple locations
